There is general agreement that rheumatic patients treated with non-biologics, as well as biologics other than B-cell-depleting agents (like RTX), do not require prophylactic antiviral therapy.
10, 11 These patients should be monitored with ALT, HBsAg or HBV DNA, and treated with antivirals when HBsAg or HBV DNA are detected ( Table 2, Figure 2).
10, 11 There is also consensus that, for patients with hematologic or oncologic diseases treated with B-cell-depleting agents like RTX, prophylactic antiviral therapy is also necessary.
